text.section: The Office shall verify that a certified minority business enterprise listed in a schedule of participation is actually performing work and receiving compensation as established in the schedule.

section.section: On completion of a contract or before final payment or release of retainage, the Commission may require a general contractor on a contract having a minority business enterprise subcontracting goal to submit to the Commission a final report of all payments made to or withheld from minority business enterprise subcontractors.
The final report shall be in affidavit form and under the penalties for perjury.
Each solicitation shall contain notice of the requirements of this subsection.
On a finding that a contractor is noncompliant, the Commission shall notify the contractor in writing of the findings and state the required corrective action.

A noncompliant contractor shall:
initiate the corrective action within 10 days after receiving the written notice; and
complete the corrective action within the time specified by the Commission.

text.section:
If the Commission finds that a general contractor is in material noncompliance with minority business enterprise contract provisions and the general contractor fails to take the corrective action required by the Commission, the Commission may:
terminate the contract;
refer the general contractor to the general manager of the Commission or the full Commission for appropriate action; or
initiate any other specific remedy identified in the contract.
